Symptom: Do you find yourself avoiding things just because they feel *uncomfortable* — not dangerous?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like your brain treats discomfort as threat?

Symptom: Do you tend to second-guess your decisions — even small ones?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like you choose, then immediately wonder if it was wrong?

Symptom: Do you struggle to hold attention during conversations — even if you're trying?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like your brain drifts and you miss part of what was said?

Symptom: Do your emotions sometimes feel too big to manage — even when they don't ‘make sense’?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like you're *feeling too much* and don’t know where to put it?

Symptom: Do you avoid activities you once enjoyed — not because you don’t care, but because you don’t *feel* anything?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like the color drained out of what used to matter?

Symptom: Do you sometimes feel like you're failing at ‘basic life stuff’ that others seem to handle easily?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like everyday functioning takes you twice the effort?

Symptom: Do you feel emotionally sensitive to rejection or criticism — even subtle things like tone or phrasing?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like you’re on alert for signs you’ve messed up or disappointed someone?

Symptom: Do you lose things often — keys, wallet, phone — even if you just had them?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like your hands are faster than your memory?

Symptom: Do you struggle to trust your memory — like you check and re-check things even when you ‘know’ you did it?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like your brain won’t let you *feel* done?

Symptom: Do you feel uncomfortable receiving praise — like it doesn’t match how you see yourself?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like compliments feel off, or directed at a version of you that isn’t real?
